result.execSummary:
The defendant Wilfredo Ramos Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence except with permission and in compliance with any injunctions/family court orders.
Comply with all injunctions and any family court orders.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Wilfredo Ramos Cruz in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  
Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Sworn in.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint or her residence except with permission and in compliance with any injunctions/family court orders.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Comply with all injunctions and any family court orders.

Costs: $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Wilfredo Ramos Cruz in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   
Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Sworn in.
Victim notification has not been complied with.

Defedant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court puts this matter over for sentencing to allow for victim notification.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Wilfredo Ramos Cruz in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   
Atty. Martinez waives the interpreters appearance (just asking for anyother date).

  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Wilfredo Ramos Cruz in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.
  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
